But he also writes that, despite Google's efforts, The fact is that we're not perfect, and combined with users' skyrocketing expectations of Google, these imperfections get magnified in perception. It's unclear whether today's post has anything to do with yesterday's announcement that co-founder Larry Page will be replacing Eric Schmidt as chief executive. ''. As Google's new chief executive, Page will lead product development and technology strategy, along with all day-to-day operations of the firm. Sergey Brin , who co-founded Google with Page, will devote his time and energy to strategic projects, in particular working on new products . His title will remain co-founder. In a blog post, Eric Schmidt said that he had been working with Page and Sergey Brin on ways to simplify Google's management structure and quicken decision making.

its current workers are located. In a speech Tuesday, Eric Schmidt said Google Inc. will hire more than 1,000 workers in Europe this year. All told, Google Inc. has more than 60 offices in 30 countries. At this stage, the number of opportunities just vastly exceed the number of people we have at the company, said Alan Eustace , Google Inc. 's senior vice-president of engineering and research. Even if it surpasses 31,000 employees this year, Google Inc. will still have far fewer people than Microsoft Corp., among its fiercest rival. Microsoft

a management restructure involving long-time chief executive Eric Schmidt becoming executive chairman. Eric Schmidt , who has led Google since 2001, will take on the new role on April 4, working mostly on external operations, including deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership .
